intro: Anastrophea, commonly known as the upside-down flower, is a unique plant species characterized by its distinctive floral structure. Its flowers are inverted, with the petals facing downward, which is an unusual feature among flowering plants. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Anastrophea belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton. Its botanical interest lies in its rare morphology and potential ecological adaptations.
